item.title: Splitgate’s portal-hopping sequel announced for 2025
item.description:
Splitgate isn’t dead yet. On Thursday, developer 1047 Games revealed a cinematic trailer for Splitgate 2, a revamped version of the free-to-play multiplayer shooter, which uses the same portal mechanic that made the game so fun the first time around.

When Splitgate 2 launches in 2025, it will come with some notable upgrades. The developers say they’ve “rebuilt everything from the ground up” in Unreal Engine 5 and also added a new faction-based system. “There will be familiar elements, but on the whole, Splitgate 2 should look and feel completely fresh from the original,” 1047 Games says.

Commonly referred to as “Halo with portals,” Splitgate became a breakout hit when it launched in 2021, racking up 10 million downloads in less than 30...

Continue reading…
item.dc:creator: Emma Roth

item.title: Amazon Prime Day 2024 sales hit record $14.2 billion
item.description:
Amazon’s Prime Day event clocked record sales this year, as U.S. consumers spent $14.2 billion across July 16 and 17, according to Adobe Analytics. This marks an 11% jump from last year’s $12.7 billion total. Buyers spent $7.2 billion on day one of the 2024 online event, up 11.2% from a year prior. Adobe Analytics […]

item.title: NASA cancels $450M Viper moon mission, dashing ice prospecting dreams
item.description:
The now-scrapped moon mission would have been the U.S. space agency's first resource-mapping mission off planet Earth.
